item.title: Python and R
item.description: Python is a coding language that I have recently explored in SDS 348. Several basic functions, similar to those utilized in R have been used, including indexing, slicing, and creating lists. Others include language features and conditionals, and can also be created. An example of some functions in python is as follows: import numpy as np x=np.array([1,2,3]) x ## array([1, 2, 3]) print(x/2+1) ## [1.5 2. 2.5] x.shape ## (3,) mat1=np.

item.title: Hello R Markdown
item.description: R Markdown This is an R Markdown document. Markdown is a simple formatting syntax for authoring HTML, PDF, and MS Word documents. For more details on using R Markdown see http://rmarkdown.rstudio.com. You can embed an R code chunk like this: summary(cars) ## speed dist ## Min. : 4.0 Min. : 2.00 ## 1st Qu.:12.0 1st Qu.: 26.00 ## Median :15.0 Median : 36.00 ## Mean :15.4 Mean : 42.98 ## 3rd Qu.
